hint: Equivalence relations partition a set into equivalence classes.
explanation: An equivalence relation requires all three properties: Reflexive (∀x Rxx), Symmetric (∀x∀y(Rxy → Ryx)), and Transitive (∀x∀y∀z((Rxy ∧ Ryz) → Rxz)). Examples: 'same age as', 'same color as', equality itself.
visual_concept: Equivalence relation divides things into groups. Everything in the same group is equivalent. = is the canonical example.
